application

Class SquareButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.SquareButton

  • public class SquareButton
extends java.lang.Object
    A square button built for use with the palette chooser only. It can either represent and display the color if the inside of the fractal or display an image. It contains methods to see if it is being clicked but contains no behaviour for what to do in such a situation.
    Author:
    Calvin

      constructs the button with the specified parameters

    • Constructor Detail

      • SquareButton

        public SquareButton(int size,
                    java.awt.Point position)
        constructs the button with the specified parameters
        Parameters:
        size - the size of one edge of the square button in pixels
        position - the position in pixels of the button on the screen

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        draws the button. If it stores an image, it will draw that. Otherwise, it will fill itself with the color it stores. The image will be cropped to match the size of the button and if the image is smaller that the button I think there will be an error, but I haven't tested it.
        Parameters:
        g - a graphics object so the button can draw itself

      • getData

        public java.awt.Color getData()
        returns the color stored and displayed by this button
        Returns:
        the color stored and displayed by this button

      • setImage

        public void setImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        takes in the new image for the button to display. The image should be square and have the same dimensions of the button. Otherwise, it will not fit properly and could even throw exceptions.
        Parameters:
        img - the new image for the button to display. The image should be square and have the same dimensions of the button. Otherwise, it will not fit properly and could even throw exceptions.

      • setData

        public void setData(java.awt.Color c)
        takes in the new color for the button to store and display.
        Parameters:
        c - the new color for the button to store and display.

      • isClicked

        public boolean isClicked(java.awt.Point p)
        returns whether or not the point passed this method is inside the button
        Parameters:
        p - the point that is being checked
        Returns:
        whether the point is inside the button

      • getLocation

        public java.awt.Point getLocation()
        returns the location of the button on the screen
        Returns:
        the location of the button on the screen
